alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 6:38PM MDT until August 11 at 8:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL SANDOVAL COUNTY... At 638 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated that thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area were rapidly diminishing. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will impact Bandelier Wilderness. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Frijoles. This includes the following streams and drainages... Frijoles, Rito de los, Grande, Rio, Into Frijoles, Rito de los, Arroyo Montoso and Into Grande, Rio. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Cerro Pelado fire burn area through the Bandelier Wilderness with potential dangerous debris flow. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
